data.title: Electrical Engineer
data.description:
Piper Companies is looking for an Electrical Engineer to join a consulting engineering firm located in Baltimore, MD. The Electrical Engineer will develop electrical and special systems design drawings and specifications associated with power, lighting, fire alarm, and low voltage designs.

Responsibilities of the Electrical Engineer include:

Create electrical and special system design drawings Effectively use AutoCAD, Revit, and Microsoft Office programs for projectsConduct calculations for power, lighting, fire alarm, and low-voltage designsCollaborate with architects and other teams/departments

Qualifications for the Electrical Engineer include:

3+ years of experiencePrevious experience using AutoCAD, BIM, Revit, and Microsoft Office programsKnowledge of forms and procedures of the engineering and construction industryExperience with low voltage systems (audiovisual, telecom, ethernet, etc.)Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical Engineering OR Architectural Engineering with an Electrical Engineering concentration from ABET accredited college or university

Compensation for the Electrical Engineer include:

Salary Range: $120,000 - $150,000 **depending on experience**Full Benefits: Medical/Dental/Vision, 401k Perks: Hybrid work schedule, PTO

Keywords: CAD, BIM, AutoCAD, Revit, Computer-aided design, building information modeling, telecom, telecommunications, engineer, electrical, electrical engineer, telecom engineer, low voltage, fire alarm, lighting, power, special system, audiovisual, ethernet, cabling, network technician, hybrid, Construction Standards Institute, CSI, American Institute of Architects, AIA, architect, design, draw, structural, 3D models, RCDD

data.title: Data Engineer
data.description:
Piper Companies is seeking a Data Engineer to cluster large datasets across various container and data platforms depending on external client needs. The Data Engineer will work hands-on with challenging data engineering, data management, and analytics projects.

Responsibilities of the Data Engineer include:

 Achieve and maintain proficiency with cluster and framework sizing, installation, debugging, performance optimization, migration, security and automation Collaborate with data scientists, analysts, business users, and IT teams to design, implement, and deploy data services and analytics. Use Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery (CI/CD) concepts to engineer a standardized data environment Recommend and advise on optimal data models for data ingestion, integration, and visualization Integrate data from a variety of data source types

Qualifications for the Data Engineer include: 

 6 years of experience in data engineering Experience with Snowflake, Databricks, Spark SQL, PySpark, and Python 3+ years cloud experience: Azure, AWS, or GCP

Compensation for the Data Engineer include:

 Salary: $135,000-145,000 Benefits: Full Health/Dental/Vision, 401K, Pension, Annual Bonus

data.title: Electrical Engineer
data.description: Designing and testing electronics boards to support a developing technology in the field of inertial sensors and navigation will be involved in this position.This job will necessitate on-site support for hardware check and troubleshooting, as well as knowledge of analog and digital simulationA skill in Mentor Graphics, RF, firmware, software, and LabVIEW would be desirable.In order to be considered for this role, a bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering and 4-6 years of experience is necessary.US Citizenship is necessary for the work.

data.title: Solar Engineer
data.description:
Job Description

Solar Engineer - Design a Brighter Future (On-Site or Fully Remote)

We are seeking a passionate Solar Engineer to join our growing team and play a key role in shaping the future of renewable energy. We design, procure, and construct innovative electrical power solutions for data centers, renewable energy projects, and microgrids.

In this role, you will leverage your expertise in solar energy to design and engineer solar photovoltaic (PV) systems for our clients. This is a unique opportunity to work with a team of industry leaders on cutting-edge projects that are transforming the power grid.

About

Do you thrive in a collaborative environment and enjoy tackling complex challenges? Are you passionate about sustainability and want to make a real impact? If so, we want to hear from you!The Opportunity:

Design and engineer solar PV systems using industry-standard software like PVsystDevelop electrical drawings and single-line diagrams for solar projectsCollaborate with engineers, project managers, and other team members to ensure successful project executionSupport project proposals and requests for quotations (RFQs)Stay up-to-date on the latest advancements in solar technologyPotential for travel to project sites (limited for senior engineers)

Qualifications

The Ideal Candidate:

Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent experience)5+ years of experience in Solar Engineering (for senior role; less experience considered for on-site Chicago position)Proven experience in PV system design using software like PVsystProficiency in electrical design principles and software (AutoCAD, Revit a plus)Excellent communication, collaboration, and problem-solving skillsStrong work ethic, with the ability to manage multiple tasks effectivelyA passion for renewable energy and sustainability

Compensation And Benefits

Why is This a Great Opportunity:

Competitive salary commensurate with experience ($80,000 - $100,000)Comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, vision insurance, 401(k) match, profit sharing, and yearly bonusesOpportunity to work on challenging and rewarding projects with a growing industry leaderFamily-oriented company culture with a focus on work-life balanceFor Senior Engineers (5+ years experience): Enjoy the flexibility of a fully remote position with occasional travel to project sites.For Junior Engineers (less than 5 years experience): Gain valuable hands-on experience working on-site in our Chicago office.

Salary Type : Annual Salary

Salary Min : $ 80000

Salary Max : $ 100000

Currency Type : USD

data.title: Mechanical Engineer
data.description: Position:  Mechanical EngineerPR: $40Location: Sanford NCDuration: 24 monthsStart Date: 5/13Shift: Onsite 6:30am - 4:00pm Musts:5-7 years engineering experienceBachelor’s degree in engineering (mechanical preferred3D Modeling (Creo preferred)Experience with GD&T (global dimension and tolerancing)Experience with troubleshooting and root cause analysisMicrosoft experience (PPT, Word, Excel)Good Communication skills (verbal and written)Time management skillsExperience with design work and drawings related to a product of sort (does not have to be construction) Plusses: Experience in a factory environment/factory supportAbility to individually maintain project status/individually manage projects Day to Day:The main function of a mechanical engineer is to research and investigate the design, functionality and maintenance of mechanical products, equipment, systems and processes. A typical mechanical engineer has the ability to make engineering drawings, and read and interpret blueprints. This is more of a design engineering role looking at the product to make sure it is at its highest qualityResponding to calls on the line and investigating if it is being assembled correctly or need to adjust the design to correctTaking the design changes and trialing it working with procurement team and technicians and validation engineering teamAt the end they have to take the updated item design and releasing it to the system  Job Responsibilities:• Research, design, develop, manufacture, and test tools, engines, machines and other mechanical devices. • Research and analyze customer design proposals, specifications, manuals to determine time and cost feasibility to complete projects. • Investigate equipment failures and difficulties to diagnose faulty operation and make recommendation to maintenance crew. • Assist drafters in developing the structural design of products using tools, equipment or software. Skills:• Creativity, verbal and written communication skills, analytical and problem solving ability. • Team player and detail oriented. • Ability to make sketches, engineering drawings and common computations. • Ability to read and interpret blueprints, technical drawing, schematics and computer-generated reports. • Previous experience with computer applications and software related to engineering field, such as Computer Aided Design (CAD).

data.title: Engineer I - DCS
data.description:
Summary

Westlake makes chemical and plastic products, which in turn make life better for people every day. We are a quality manufacturer and dependable global supplier of petrochemicals, plastics and building products. Our mission is to serve our clients by enhancing daily life through the products and services we provide.

Duties And Responsibilities

May include, but are not limited to, the following:

Entry level maintenance of Westlake process control systems and process communications to business networkModify and implement new process control schemes for DCS/SIS plant systemsWork with operations groups on process problems and ways to automate chemical operations Tests troubleshoot, and provide to technical problemsParticipate in following project tasks such as System Design, Programming, FAT, SAT/Commissioning, Graphics Design, Alarm ManagementFollow corporate and local safety and environmental regulationThis position will be required to drive company vehicles from time to time.

Education, Experience And Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Chemical, Electrical, or Computer EngineeringDemonstrated interest and ability in computer programming or other similar technical systemsAbility to solve problems logically and efficientlyAvailable to work after-hour, weekend and holidaysChemical industry experience preferredExperience in Honeywell, DeltaV, and/or ABB PLC systems preferred.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to sit; stand; walk; use hands to touch, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms; and talk or hear. The employee is occasionally required to stoop, kneel, or crouch. Employee may be required to use stairs/elevators and have the ability to work at elevated heights. The employee must regularly lift and/or move up to 10 pounds, frequently lift and/or move up to 25 pounds, and occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.

WORK ENVIRONMENT

The noise level in the work environment is sometimes moderate when working inside, however, some of the work may be required in the operating units which mandates usage of required PPE and safety equipment including safety glasses, hearing protection, etc. May also result in exposure to outside elements and may require usage of stairs. Travel may occasionally be required.

data.title: Data Engineer
data.description:
Job Title : Data Engineer (Databricks Platform Modernization)

MUST HAVES Skills/Tech: 5-7 years experience

 Hands-on experience with Databricks and Azure , including implementation using Unity Catalog.  Experience in platform modernization projects and implementation.  Deep understanding of components of data and analytics (building data platforms, data platform management, data extraction, ETL/ELT, data security, and data/insight reporting) 


Job Responsibilities:

 Collaborate with cross-functional teams to architect, implement, and optimize Cencora’s cloud Data & Analytics platform throughout all phases of data ingestion.  Evaluate and integrate software technologies into our modern platform, ensuring compatibility and scalability while leveraging configurable self-service tools.  Lead technical discussions and facilitate collaboration among technical stakeholders to make informed decisions and drive architecture designs.  Document meeting notes, technical conversations, and architectural decisions to ensure alignment and enable knowledge sharing across teams.  Explore emerging features and technologies in the data and analytics space, conducting research and analysis to identify opportunities for improvement.  Hands-on evaluation and testing of tools and technologies, including Databricks and Azure , to support data platform management, data extraction, UI/UX presentation, and generative AI.  Collaborate with delivery and platform teams to implement architectural strategies, design solutions, and ensure successful project outcomes.  Evaluate, propose, and implement data writing solutions using tools like Power BI, ensuring data governance, security, and compliance requirements are met. 


Required Skills and Qualifications:

 5-7 years of proven experience in Data Engineering roles, with a strong understanding of Data and Analytics components.  Expertise in cloud platforms, particularly Databricks and Azure, with hands-on experience in architecting and implementing data solutions.  Proficiency in data platform management, data extraction, UI/UX presentation, and generative AI, with a strong technical background in data ops and data governance.  Ability to lead technical discussions, document decisions, and communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.  Proactive, independent, and self-motivated with a natural curiosity and desire to explore emerging technologies and industry trends.  Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field (or equivalent work experience)

data.title: Transmission Engineer
data.description:
We are seeking skilled Transmission Engineers with experience in substation projects to join our client's team on a 12-24 months assignment in Richmond, VA. 
Our client is a leader in the energy industry, committed to delivering reliable power and innovative solutions to customers.
Job Description: As a Transmission Engineer, you will play a critical role in the design, coordination, and management of transmission line projects, focusing on substation integration and regulatory compliance.
ResponsibilitiesEngineer and coordinate transmission line activities, ensuring adherence to engineering standards and project specifications.Provide technical guidance and approval for the work of engineers involved in transmission projects.Prepare project scopes, estimates, and budgets for transmission projects.Support permitting, construction, field operations, and maintenance groups throughout project lifecycles.Offer technical expertise and address inquiries regarding underground transmission lines from civic groups, government agencies, and media representatives.Participate in project informational meetings, public workshops, and prepare State Corporation Commission CPCN applications.Design and analyze transmission systems, including substation layouts and integration.Develop engineering specifications and standards for transmission line projects.Collaborate with project teams to ensure successful execution of transmission projects within scope, budget, and timeline.Manage vendor relationships and oversee quality control processes related to transmission equipment and materials.Conduct feasibility studies and technical assessments for transmission system upgrades and expansions.
RequirementsBachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering or related field.Proven experience (minimum 4 years) in transmission engineering, with a focus on substation design and integration.Strong proficiency in engineering software/tools for transmission system analysis and design.Excellent communication skills and ability to convey technical information effectively.Knowledge of regulatory requirements and industry standards in transmission system design and substation integration.
Preferred QualificationsProfessional Engineering (PE) license is a plus.Experience working in the energy or utility industry.
Benefits:Competitive compensation package.Opportunity to work with a leading energy company on impactful transmission projects.Potential for career development and growth within the organization.Per diem available to non-local candidates.
Application Process: If you are interested in this exciting opportunity, please submit your resume outlining your qualifications and relevant experience. We look forward to reviewing your application.

data.title: Materials Engineer
data.description: Net2Source is a Global Workforce Solutions Company headquartered at NJ, USA with its branch offices in Asia Pacific Region. We are one of the fastest growing IT Consulting company across the USA and we are hiring "NDT/NDE Engineer" for one of our clients. We offer a wide gamut of consulting solutions customized to our 450+ clients ranging from Fortune 500/1000 to Start-ups across various verticals like Technology, Financial Services, Healthcare, Life Sciences, Oil & Gas, Energy, Retail, Telecom, Utilities, Technology, Manufacturing, the Internet, and Engineering.  Materials Engineer 12+ Months Tukwila, WA Rate-40-70/hour(Depending on experience)  Job Description: Work statement is a non-managerial role, non-leadership role. Directs and initiates complex analysis and evaluation of parts, materials, processes, technology or equipment through research and testing to ensure safety, reliability and adherence to requirements and specifications. Leads and directs analysis of failed parts and processes to reduce or eliminate future failures. Leads and directs efforts to generate test plans, identify and categorize failure, determine root cause and document results and recommendations. Leads the proposal, development and validation of revisions to procedures and specifications. Directs the design, development, fabrication, testing, evaluation and implementation of new concepts and technology to resolve complex problems and support continuous improvement. Consults with others to resolve complex or high-impact issues with suppliers and customers. Provides direction, consultation and technical expertise to internal and external customers. Coaches and mentors others.  Required Skills NDT Testing Non-Destructive Eval Processes Quality Tech Documentation Process Management Skills  If you are interested, please forward your resume to Satish.a@net2source.com and call me at (201) 484-7963 Ext.389 or please refer any suitable candidates for this role.   Thanks Satish Abrol Technical Recruiter Satish.a@net2source.com (201) 484-7963 Ext.389 270 Davidson Ave Suite 704

data.title: Quality Engineer
data.description:
Due to the nature of the business, candidate must be a US Citizen

Location: Hanover or Lansdale, PA

About SKF

SKF has been making the world spin since 1907! 

SKF is an industry-leading manufacturer dedicated to a culture of belonging, where our people flourish in an equitable environment that promotes leadership development and career growth. SKF bearings played an integral role in helping Mars Rover collect rock and regolith samples on the planet’s surface.

As an SKF team member, you will join 40,000 colleagues from more than 130 countries developing bearing technology and services that make rotation more reliable and sustainable. Sustainability is at the heart of everything we do. SKF aims to have net zero greenhouse gas emissions at all our production facilities by 2030.

SKF products keep vehicles rolling, power the machines that put food on your table, and even reach into the cosmos as part of the Mars rover mission. Founded in Sweden in 1907, today SKF is publicly traded on the Nasdaq Stockholm with annual sales in 2020 of approximately $10 billion.

Job Summary

This position is responsible for providing leadership and support on assigned programs and projects ensuring the Company's products are manufactured in accordance with specifications. Serve as a liaison between customer, vendor (s), and company on quality-related concerns. This position will report to the quality manager (mounted products).

Responsibilities Include But Not Limited To

Develop and maintain supplier audit systems. Create and maintain Process Flow, Process Control Plans, and FMEA. Ensure adherence to the highest standards in castings, (gray / ductile iron, steel and aluminum), machining, paint, and assembly. Collaborate with suppliers to improve their quality processes and procedures. Focus on continuous improvement and operational excellence. Review and analyze supplier performance metrics. Identify areas for improvement and work collaboratively to address issues. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and implement quality assurance processes for incoming materials. Utilize Quality Management Systems. Investigate customer complaints and issue corrective actions. Lead root cause analysis investigations to prevent reoccurrence. Develop and maintain documentation including supplier quality manuals, quality plans, and reports. Review and approve supplier part submission; PPAP, ISIR, FAI. Facilitate the resolution of quality issues involving suppliers and internal teams to ensure customer satisfaction. Support new supplier qualifications, including initial assessments and ongoing performance monitoring. Participate in the development and review of specifications for castings. Ensure compliance with regulatory and industry standards, including ISO 9001. Interface with Sales, Customer Solutions, and Applications Engineering. Communicate changes in production plan based on customer requirements. Assist with performing quarterly supplier reviews. Assist in product audits and supplier audits. Assist with customer returns (TER’s). 

Working Environment And Conditions

Office environment with regular visits to manufacturing and supplier facilities. Travel may be required up to 30% of the time. Willingness to travel domestically and internationally to supplier sites as needed. Must have valid USA Driver’s License for travel purposes. 

Job Education, Experience, And Qualifications

US Citizenship is required due to the nature of work. Bachelor’s degree in Materials Science, Mechanical Engineering, or a related field from an accredited university. A minimum of 5 years of experience in quality engineering, with a focus on foundries, machining, paint processes and assembly. Proficiency in using quality tools such as FMEA, SPC, APQP, PPAP, and MSA. Familiarity with quality management systems such as ISO 9001, IATF 16949, or similar. Professional certification such as ASQ Certified Quality Engineer (CQE) is a plus. Demonstrated experience in supplier development and management. 

Preferred Qualifications

Comprehensive understanding of casting processes, material properties, associated standards, and specifications. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to lead root cause analysis investigations and develop viable solutions. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to work collaboratively with internal teams and suppliers. Experience working with global suppliers and understanding of international quality standards Knowledge of SKF Quality Management Systems. 

What You’ll Love About SKF

Rest and Relaxation. Enjoy a generous PTO policy and 13 paid holidays.

Work/Life Integration. SKF supports work/life integration, home, family, community, personal well-being and health. Flexible work options available, depending on role.

SKF Celebrates Diversity in the Workplace.  We strive to embed Diversity, Equity and Inclusion in everything we do. By developing a culture of belonging, our people can flourish; leading to an inclusive, equitable environment that promotes leadership, engagement and innovation.

Best in Class Benefits. SKF cares about the wellbeing of our employees. Comprehensive healthcare options to fit your needs and opt out payment. Added benefits include company paid life insurance, STD, LTD. Supplemental benefits include critical illness coverage, tuition reimbursement, employee discount programs, and much more!

Invest in your Future. Participate in our 401K program that boasts a 10% employer contribution: 100% match up to 5% of your elected contribution (100% Vested) plus an additional 5% company contribution.

Reports to: Quality Manager

Location: Hanover, PA

Job ID: 19185

SKF provides equal employment [and affirmative action] opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability.

By applying to this job you acknowledge how SKF treats candidate data. Click HERE to review the SKF Data Privacy Consent Statement.

data.title: Application Engineer
data.description:
Location: Flexible: Falconer, NY, Lansdale, PA or Plymouth, MI all will be considered

Salary Range: $84,000 - $101,000

About SKF

SKF has been making the world spin since 1907!

SKF is an industry-leading manufacturer dedicated to a culture of belonging, where our people flourish in an equitable environment that promotes leadership development and career growth. SKF bearings played an integral role in helping Mars Rover collect rock and regolith samples on the planet’s surface.

As an SKF team member, you’ll join 40,000 colleagues from more than 130 countries developing bearing technology and services that make rotation more reliable and sustainable. Sustainability is at the heart of everything we do. SKF aims to have net zero greenhouse gas emissions at all our production facilities by 2030.

SKF products keep vehicles rolling, power the machines that put food on your table, and even reach into the cosmos as part of the Mars rover mission. Founded in Sweden in 1907, today SKF is publicly traded on the Nasdaq Stockholm with annual sales in 2020 of approximately $10 billion.

Job Summary

We are looking for an Application Engineer for our NA Aerospace team. This position reports to the Director of Product Development and Engineering manages the technical relationship with SKF’s customers, working closely with Sales and Customer Service as part of the responsible account team. Responsibilities include developing customer technical needs and translating them into an SKF offering, including proposal and 1st tier drawings for all product platforms, evaluating technical risks, verifying product selection, and analyzing product field service history. This engineer promotes SKF know-how and value propositions in-line with corporate strategy and is part of a global team with access to SKF’s subject matter experts to aid in design, analysis and lessons learned. The engineer would also be responsible for problem solving, preliminary engineering calculations, modeling/simulation/analysis, and solution determination in cases of customer complaints or application specific requests with regard to product performance and failure risk analysis.

Job Duties and Responsibilities are (including but not limited to):

Look for and chase new business opportunities by understanding what customers need and want, spotting market trends, introducing current and new SKF technology to strategic business opportunities. Develop and support Aircraft Engine, Helicopter Transmission, and e-Aviation customers within the North America region. Help coordinate engineering activities from the beginning of a business opportunity until the end of production, following the ETO (Engineering to Order) process. Make sure to follow verification and validation procedures correctly and keep track of how our products are performing in the field. Conduct bearing calculations; get ready and keep track of design and process validation test plans using resources from the SKF Aerospace team. Regularly collaborate with the customer’s engineering team to solve technical problems and get approval for changes to products or processes throughout the program’s life cycle: help solve technical issues and make sure lessons learned are used in the business. Work with and have an impact on a fast-moving global team of people from engineering, sales, business development, project management, design, quality, testing, manufacturing, and customer service; create and give technical presentations and training events to large groups of customers. Coordinate and keep tasks aligned that involve many customers in your region or assignment and build and improve relationships with customers’ engineering/technical teams with the target of implementing innovative light weight and/or low friction solutions to reach the CO2 emissions reduction of the aerospace industry. Assist customers with the selection of environmentally friendly/compliant bearing solutions for their applications. 

Desired Education, Knowledge, And Skills

An Engineering degree. If it’s in Mechanical, Material or Aerospace Engineering, that’s even better. If you have experience in technical sales or applications engineering, that’s a plus. Working knowledge (advanced experience a plus) of rolling bearings, airframe bearings, aerospace materials and basic calculations related to the same is highly desired. Be a good listener and communicator of technical knowledge (both in writing and speaking). Ability to speak and write in English well. You should have a good personality and be good at managing relationships with customers. This will help you motivate and influence the technical choices of our customers. If you have experience with calculation tools and engineering design software, and if you know about manufacturing processes, that’s a plus. Flexibility to travel within the US (up to 30%) and (very occasionally) internationally. 

What You’ll Love About SKF

Rest and Relaxation. Enjoy a generous PTO policy and 13 paid holidays.

Work/Life Integration. SKF supports work/life integration, home, family, community, personal well-being and health. Flexible work options available, depending on role.

Diversity in the Workplace. At SKF, we strive to embed Diversity, Equity and Inclusion in everything we do. By developing a culture of belonging, our people can flourish; leading to an inclusive, equitable environment that promotes leadership, engagement and innovation.

Best in Class Benefits. SKF cares about the wellbeing of our employees. Comprehensive healthcare options to fit your needs and opt out payment. Added benefits include company paid life insurance, STD, LTD. Supplemental benefits include critical illness coverage, tuition reimbursement, employee discount programs, and much more!

Invest in your Future. Participate in our 401K program that boasts a 10% employer contribution: 100% match up to 5% of your elected contribution (100% Vested) plus an additional 5% company contribution.

Reports to: Aero Product Development and Engineering US Manager

Location: Flexible: Falconer, NY, Lansdale, PA or Plymouth, MI all will be considered

Job ID: 19403

Salary Range: $84,000 - $101,000

SKF provides equal employment [and affirmative action] opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability.

By applying to this job you acknowledge how SKF treats candidate data. Click HERE to review the SKF Data Privacy Consent Statement.

data.title: Software Engineer
data.description:
Job Summary:As a Software Engineer II, you’ll work on our Automotive Marketing Platform (AMP) product that is changing the way dealers are marketing to customers through email, CRM tasks, text messaging, direct mail, and Facebook with more channels to come. Our applications are written in .NetCore and AWS. We use New Relic, Splunk, and PagerDuty to monitor and alert on our platform. 
We own and are responsible for our applications from design, development, testing, deployment, and support. Our infrastructure is a mix of on-prem and AWS, and we manage it using Terraform. We use CI/CD best practices to develop, test, and deploy our applications. We use a wide variety of AWS services, including but not limited to Elastic Beanstalk, Elastic Container Service, Lambdas, SQS, Dynamo DB, Terraform, and RDS to process a large volume of data, work with products and architects to learn, and apply those learnings to future product and technical development. Our engineering organization supports addressing technical debt. In addition to working with product owners to prioritize and fix defects as necessary, we reserve one sprint a quarter to work on things that are bugging us. This can include but is not limited to cleaning up noisy alerts, automating manual processes, and revisiting code if we think there’s a better way to do it using the tools we have available. We have an annual Hackathon with winners going on to compete at a higher level within our parent company. We have time reserved on the calendar annually to learn more about both internal and external products. If you want to work on highly performant software running at scale in the cloud, with the ability to both learn new technologies and have an impact on our ability to succeed as a team, organization, and company, this job is for you.
 Technologies: .NetCore, C#, SQL, AWS (including but not limited to Elastic Beanstalk, Elastic Container Service, Lambdas, SQS, Dynamo DB, Terraform, and RDS), Typescript, Snowflake, dbt, NewRelic, Splunk, K6, SpecFlow, GitHub, Octopus, Resharper
Your Role:marketing solutions for expanding our Automotive Marketing Platformbuild, and support cloud-native applications that serve our digital marketing stakeholdersWork with senior-level engineers on the team to implement patterns for our organization that deliver our software products at scale with observability, performance, and securityMentor junior-level engineers on best practices and standardsand build service-oriented architecture solutions, constructing and managing services published to both internal and external consumers, and integrating with complex database and third-party componentswith your agile delivery team to build a culture of passion, trust, and creativityand leverage the automotive digital marketing domain to change the way the world buys, sells, and uses cars
Qualifications  Required Experience:degree in Computer Science or related field or relevant experience. Advanced technical degree and/or related training a plus.years of multi-threaded server-side web application development experience

Compensation:Up to $100k/yr per year annual salary. Exact compensation may vary based on several factors, including skills, experience, and education. Benefit packages for this role include: Benefit packages for this role may include healthcare insurance offerings and paid leave as provided by applicable law.

data.title: Product Engineer I
data.description:
Exciting 2 year contract Product Engineer opportunity to work for a global leader dedicated to helping people see brilliantly. The largest device company in the world – with complementary businesses in Surgical and Vision Care.
***New Grads with an Advanced degree in Biomedical Engineering with High a GPA***Medical, Dental, Holiday, PTO and 401 K
Work with Cataract and Vitreoretinal R&D groups on development projects resulting in achieving R&D’s project goals. Tasks include supplier evaluation/qualification, component qualification, managing prototype builds, assuring assembly process is developed and documented, assure BOM’s are entered and maintained correctly, assure product costs are accurate and rolled, conduct Production Readiness Review.- Support Product transfer projects either into or out of plant.- Identify and qualify alternate materials and/or components for either risk mitigation or because of obsolescence.- Maintain adequate supply of purchased components through contact with Procurement and the Suppliers. Qualify tooling and equipment as required to assure capacity.- Address any component or product quality issue assigned, determining root cause and completing corrective action.- Address any requests from other departments related to BOM’s and components.- Manage product labeling.- Identify and qualify Cost Improvements.

- Communicates clearly is a problem solver and collaborates well.- Speaks/writes English.- Works well with others.- Has leadership capability and is self starter.- Ability to learn and retain many complex processes quickly.- Focuses on detail/quality.- Experience writing technical protocols/reports.- Ability to use MS Word/Excel/PowerPoint/Project.- Root cause analysis experience to determining cause of issues.- Experience in Medical Device industry - Manufacturing / Design / Quality Engineering fields- preferred.- 1 year of experience in an engineering or scientific R&D or manufacturing environment preferred.- Targeting a Masters in Biomedical Engineering.
This job description is a complete list of all desired skills but not all are required. We strongly encourage candidates who have some of the skills to apply. We look forward to a conversation to learn more about you!

data.title: Process Engineer
data.description:
Position Summary:The Process Engineer will plan and design product applications and machinery. The position is responsible for organizing highly complex activities for design, development, implementation, and maintenance of heat exchanger manufacturing processes.
FULLY ON-SITE, Contract to HirePay Rate: $65/hour 
Duties and Responsibilities:• Apply continuous improvement methods such as lean manufacturing to enhance manufacturing quality, reliability, or cost-effectiveness, including determining root causes of failures using statistical methods and recommend changes in designs, tolerances, or processing methods.• Design, install, and troubleshoot manufacturing equipment.• Identify opportunities and implement changes to improve products or reduce costs using knowledge of fabrication processes, tooling and production equipment, assembly methods, quality control standards, or product design, materials and parts.• Design testing methods and test finished products or process capabilities to establish standards or validate process requirements.• Design layout of equipment or workspaces to achieve maximum efficiency.• Review product designs for manufacturability or completeness; including purchasing equipment, materials, or parts and preparing documentation for new manufacturing processes or engineering procedures.• Evaluate manufactured products according to specifications and quality standards, including troubleshooting new or existing product problems involving designs, materials, or processes• Develop sustainable manufacturing technologies and analyze the financial impacts of sustainable manufacturing• Provide technical expertise or support related to manufacturing.• Develop, document and implement standard work instructions for critical manufacturing operations.
Required Skills and Abilities:• Excellent people and communication skills are required (both oral and written).• Strong interpersonal skills requiring the ability to resolve conflicting interests and obtain cooperation• Computer literacy in a MRP system (Oracle a plus), Microsoft Office.• Able to work under pressure• Highly technical and analytical skills such (drawings, schematics, layout)• Able to think out of box.• Project management skills• Highly organized and efficient• Possess leadership and interpersonal skills• Strong problem-solving skills
Education and Experience:• Bachelors degree in Industrial Engineering• 3-5 years of progressive experience in manufacturing engineering.• Experience in metal fabrication, welding and/or brazing of pressure containing products.• Experience in a highly regulated industry, such as, Military, Aerospace, Nuclear or Automotive or other similar.• Due to ITAR Restrictions, an export license may be required.
Other• Due to contracts with the United States Government, the candidate must be either a US Citizen or Green card holder
Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled 
Benefit offerings available for our associates include medical, dental, vision, life insurance, short-term disability, additional voluntary benefits, EAP program, commuter benefits and a 401K plan. Our benefit offerings provide employees the flexibility to choose the type of coverage that meets their individual needs. In addition, our associates may be eligible for paid leave including Paid Sick Leave or any other paid leave required by Federal, State, or local law, as well as Holiday pay where applicable.To read our Candidate Privacy Information Statement, which explains how we will use your information, please visit https://www.modis.com/en-us/candidate-privacy/ 
The Company will consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

data.title: Network Engineer
data.description:
IntePros is seeking a Network Engineer for one of our client's the leading health insurance provider in the Philadelphia marketplace.
Responsibilities:Manage LAN/MAN/WAN, Firewall (VPN), Load Balancing Technology, Wireless Networking, and Cloud Networking.Document and maintain advanced troubleshooting techniques and capacity planning methods on systems.Provide research and recommendations for continuous process improvement, including evaluating vendor proposals.Work on medium to large complexity projects as a project team member.Perform duties of the Sr. Network Engineer as required.Qualifications:BS in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science/Engineering, or equivalent.7+ years of Data Network experience preferred.In-depth knowledge of Cisco Switching and Routing, F5 LTM/ASM, network Security, network management systems.CCNA, CCNP, Cisco Certified Network Associate, or equivalent hands-on and network design experience.F5-CSE certification preferred.Skills:Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and balance daily workload with projects.Ability to collaborate with Project Managers to ensure successful and timely project completion.Strong technical proficiency in network hardware and software installation, maintenance, and repair.Extensive knowledge of LAN/WAN/wireless/VoIP technology, network infrastructure, design, topology, protocols, and operating procedures.Expertise in Cisco Nexus and Catalyst Switch Technology, Cisco ISR and ASR Router Technology, and routing protocols.Familiarity with Cisco NFG Firewall, Cisco Wireless Technology, Application Load Balancer, DNS/DHCP, IPAM Technology, and other related technologies.Experience with network monitoring tools and strong network troubleshooting skills.

data.title: Manufacturing Engineer
data.description:
The Manufacturing Engineer position can occur in Process, Production or Technology.

The Manufacturing Engineer - Process is responsible for providing innovative and cost effective processes and solutions required to manufacture products. This includes the design and development of new and improved manufacturing techniques, processes and procedures. He/she develops, maintains, and continuously improves manufacturing processes and techniques using LEAN. He/she develops standards and establishes implementation plans, including training plans for shop floor personnel, and production metrics. He/she collaborates with Engineering and Manufacturing Technology to ensure that processes are created and developed for new products and that return-on-experience is captured for existing processes.

Required

The Manufacturing Engineer - Production performs the lead role in the implementation of manufacturing processes and techniques - and the implementation of LEAN and use of Six Sigma tools. He/she is the owner of their respective manufacturing processes and standards and enforces implementation by training shop floor personnel, implementing and monitoring metrics, and oversight. He/she is responsible to solve complex manufacturing problems and take an active role in troubleshooting quality and production yield related issues within manufacturing. The Manufacturing Engineer - Technology is responsible for finding, investigating, and/or creating new, next generation, innovative and cost effective technology solutions required to manufacture existing and new products. This includes the creation and development of a manufacturing technology roadmap for new and existing product technologies. For new technologies, he/she takes processes from the concept phase all the way to successful implementation. For Manufacturing Engineer - Process:

Lean Six Sigma.Responsible for the design and continuous improvement of processes using Lean concepts, such as: standardized work instructions, line balancing, layout and work sequence (routing) optimization, training development matrix, Value Stream Mapping, Kaizen/5S workouts, pull processes, TPM (total preventive maintenance), cell design, and quick changeover/batch-size optimization.Drive process optimization using Six Sigma tools such as Design of Experiments.Processes.Leads the production team in designing and continuously improving manufacturing process to improve yield, cycle time and productivity.Implement engineering specifications into processes and provides shop feedback to capture lessons learnt for existing and future designs.Creates, implements, and monitors key performance indicators and metrics on manufacturing process capability and product quality.Responsible for establishing and improving manufacturing process cost.Quality.Responsible for assisting in investigation, root cause analysis and corrective actions tied to manufacturing process quality.


For Manufacturing Engineer - Production:

Lean Six Sigma.Responsible for the implementation of key elements of Lean, such as: standardized work instructions, line balancing, layout and work sequence (routing) optimization, training development matrix, Value Stream Mapping, Kaizen/5S workouts, pull processes, TPM (total preventive maintenance), cell design, and quick changeover/batch-size optimization.Processes.Implement process improvements to achieve manufacturing excellence in areas such as process yield (e.g. First Pass Yield, Rolled Throughput Yield), cycle time reduction and productivity.Provide shop floor feedback on product design and manufacturability issues to Engineering and DFMs (e.g. through the use of Engineering Change Requests - ECRs).Review and sign-off on Engineering Change Orders that impact Inventory - including product life cycle issues, obsolescence, etc.Creates, implements, and monitors key performance indicators and metrics on manufacturing process capability and product quality.Monitoring and reducing process costs.Quality.Responsible to assist with investigation, root cause analysis and corrective action implementation for manufacturing quality issues.


For Manufacturing Engineer - Technology:

Lean Six Sigma.Responsible to ensure that new processes are established using Lean concepts, such as: standardized work instructions, line balancing, layout and work sequence (routing) optimization, training development matrix, Value Stream Mapping, Kaizen/5S workouts, pull processes, TPM (total preventive maintenance), cell design, and quick changeover/batch-size optimization.Also responsible for driving continuous improvement projects on manufacturing processes.Processes.Evaluates and benchmarks best-in-class manufacturing techniques for Schlumberger and OEM products.Establishes pilot testing and scale up plan for manufacturing technology implementation.Works with Manufacturing and Engineering Métiers and other stakeholders during prove-out testing of processes.Supports the Manufacturing Engineer (DFM) on any specific technology issues/constraints for NPD and RR projects.Coordinates with Manufacturing Métiers and other resources across the company to share and leverage best practices.Quality.Responsible for ensuring that manufacturing technology solutions achieve the required quality levels, reliability and consistency.

data.title: Project Engineer
data.description:
Salary: $100K – $120K
What is your perfect fit?Do you enjoy planning, coordinating, and executing projects from concept to manufacturing launch?Are you a creative and strategic thinker?Are you successful at completing projects on time and within budget?If that describes you, we need to talk!
What your future day will look like:Coordination and execution of engineering projectsCreate and maintain project charters, GANTT charts and time schedules to ensure company procedures and guidelinesIdentify resources needed to fulfill projectsMonitor project progress to ensure quality requirements, timeline milestones and cost targets are metMaintain an open line of communication with customers, project core team members and suppliersPrepare project presentations and create engineering reportsSupport program launches at other company locations as needed
Benefits Offered:Company offers an excellent benefits package!Health/Dental/Vision Insurance401KPTO
Type: Direct Hire
To be a champion in this role, you will need:B.S. in Engineering required3+ years of experience in project engineeringExcellent communication skills (written & verbal)Excellent mathematical, analytical and computer skillsAbility to work in a fast-paced environmentKnowledge of AIAG Core Tools and TS-16949 preferredAbility to travel up to 25%, including international travel
We know you are more than a resume and understand your next career move needs to be the right fit! If this is your first time considering Godshall as your trusted partner, welcome! Once you have applied, we will review your experience and skills. You will then hear back quickly with the next steps.
If you have already spoken with Godshall, please reach out to your recruiter. We will happily update your file and make sure we are considering you for all roles your experience and skills are a perfect fit for.

data.title: Material Engineer
data.description:
Net2Source is a Global Workforce Solutions Company headquartered at NJ, USA with its branch offices in Asia Pacific Region. We are one of the fastest growing IT Consulting companies across the USA and we are hiring " Material Engineer" for one of our clients. We offer a wide gamut of consulting solutions customized to our 450+ clients ranging from Fortune 500/1000 to Start-ups across various verticals like Technology, Financial Services, Healthcare, Life Sciences, Oil & Gas, Energy, Retail, Telecom, Utilities, Technology, Manufacturing, the Internet, and Engineering.
Job Title: Material Engineer Location: Chillicothe IL Duration: 24 Months Contract (Possible of Extension) Pay Rate: $28-33/hr.
The main function of a research engineer is to research and investigate the design, functionality and maintenance of mechanical products, equipment, systems and processes. A typical research engineer has the ability to make engineering drawings, and read and interpret blueprints.
Position’s Contributions to Work Group: 
Individual will work under the direction of an experienced non-metallic engineer to collaborate with design teams and manufacturing engineers in the development of new designs and troubleshooting existing designs and processes. Assist engineers in understanding trade-offs when considering various non-metallic materials for designs. Job involves validation of materials and processes for new applications, writing and revising material specifications, and failure analysis.
Typical task breakdown:Reviewing material specifications (mostly polymers and adhesives)Consulting with design engineers to determine the suitability of materials for applications.Preparing summary reportsAttending technical meetingsLab testing as needed.Comparing/contrasting material properties
Education & Experience Required: Bachelor’s degree in chemistry, chemical engineering, plastics technology/engineering, materials science, or related field
Technical Skills Proficiency with computer, especially with MS Word, Excel, and Outlook
(Desired) 1-3 years of experience in plastic and/or adhesive material selection, manufacturing, and/or designAbility to learn basic print reading and data analysis tools
Soft SkillsGood organizational skills, ability to work independently, and good oral and written communication skillsWillingness and motivation to learn new technologies and concepts.
Regards,Md NawabTechnical RecruiterNet2Source Inc.Global HQ Address – 7250 Dallas Pkwy, Suite 825 Plano, Texas 75024Office: (201) 340-8700 x Ext 322 | Cell: (201) 266-0242| Fax: (201) 221-8131| Email: nawab.md@net2source.com

data.title: Polymer Engineer
data.description:
Hello,
Net2Source is a Global Workforce Solutions Company headquartered at NJ, USA with its branch offices in Asia Pacific Region. We are one of the fastest growing IT Consulting company across the USA and we are hiring  " Material Engineer (Entry-Level) "  for one of our clients. We offer a wide gamut of consulting solutions customized to our 450+ clients ranging from Fortune 500/1000 to Start-ups across various verticals like Technology, Financial Services, Healthcare, Life Sciences, Oil & Gas, Energy, Retail, Telecom, Utilities, Technology, Manufacturing, the Internet, and Engineering.
Job Title: Material Engineer (Entry-Level) Location: Chillicothe ILDuration: 24+ Months Pay Rate: $30 - $33/hr. 
Summary Individual will work under the direction of an experienced non-metallic engineer to collaborate with design teams and manufacturing engineers in the development of new designs and troubleshooting existing designs and processes. Assist engineers in understanding trade-offs when considering various non-metallic materials for designs. Job involves validation of materials and processes for new applications, writing and revising material specifications, and failure analysis.
Job Responsibilities:Reviewing material specifications (mostly polymers and adhesives)Consulting with design engineers to determine the suitability of materials for applications.Preparing summary reportsAttending technical meetingsLab testing as needed.Comparing/contrasting material propertiesDaily, one-on-one discussions with various team members and internal clientsE-mails and messagingIn-person and virtual Teams meetings
Skills:Creativity, verbal and written communication skills, analytical and problem-solving ability.Team player and detail oriented.Ability to make sketches, engineering drawings and common computations.Ability to read and interpret blueprints, technical drawing, schematics, and computer-generated reports.Previous experience with computer applications and software related to engineering field, such as Computer Aided Design (CAD).
Education & Experience Required: Bachelor's degree in chemistry, chemical engineering, plastics technology/engineering, materials science, or related field
Technical Skills Proficiency with computer, especially with MS Word, Excel, and Outlook
(Desired) 1-3 years of experience in plastic and/or adhesive material selection, manufacturing, and/or designAbility to learn basic print reading and data analysis tools.
Soft SkillsGood organizational skills, ability to work independently, and good oral and written communication skills.Willingness and motivation to learn new technologies and concepts.
Thanks & Regards, 
Swati Rai Delivery Manager Net2Source Inc. 270 Davidson Ave, Suite 704, Somerset, NJ 08873 Office: (201) 340-8700 x 547 | Cell: (201) 623-3468 | Email Id: swati.rai@net2source.com
